test_questions.question: Match the roles in Scrum with their responsibilities:

options.A: Product Owner → Manages the product backlog and prioritizes features
options.B: Scrum Master → Facilitates meetings and removes obstacles for the team
options.C: Development Team → Develops software increments and implements backlog items

test_questions.question: Match the principles with their descriptions:

options.A: KISS (Keep It Simple, Stupid) → Simple designs are easier to maintain and debug
options.B: Think! → Clear, deliberate thought before action
options.C: Plan Ahead for Reuse → Develop reusable components to save time later

test_questions.question: What is a major challenge faced by global software development (GSD) teams?

options.A: Coordinating and communicating effectively across geographical distances
options.B: Managing time zone differences
options.C: Cultural and language barriers

test_questions.question: What is the main benefit of using GitHub Codespaces?

options.A: It allows developers to write code directly in a browser based VS Code environment
options.B: It provides pre-configured development environments
options.C: It reduces setup time for new developers

test_questions.question: What are the key benefits of using incremental models like Scrum or Kanban? (Select all that apply)

options.A: Early and frequent customer feedback
options.B: Better adaptability to evolving requirements
options.C: Prioritizing lightweight documentation

test_questions.question: According to the IEEE definition, what is the core concept of software engineering?

options.A: Developing software with a systematic, disciplined, quantifiable approach
options.B: Writing code as quickly as possible
options.C: Focusing only on programming without documentation
options.D: Using the latest technologies regardless of project needs

test_questions.question: Which practices help in resolving merge conflicts effectively? (Select all that apply)

options.A: Communicating with team members who worked on the conflicting changes
options.B: Reviewing changes in the conflict file to decide which lines to keep
options.C: Using GitHub's online editor to manually resolve conflicts
options.D: Deleting the entire file and starting over

test_questions.question: What does the term "process flow" describe in a software process?

options.A: The sequence and timing of framework activities
options.B: The speed of development
options.C: The number of bugs in the system

test_questions.question: Why is the waterfall model often criticized for modern software development?

options.A: It does not allow for iterative feedback during development
options.B: It is too flexible and lacks structure
options.C: It requires too much customer involvement
options.D: It is too expensive to implement

test_questions.question: Which approaches can be used to resolve conflicting requirements from multiple stakeholders during the communication phase? (Select all that apply)

options.A: Conducting facilitated negotiation meetings
options.B: Refining requirements through iterative feedback
options.C: Ignoring some stakeholders' inputs
options.D: Using voting to decide which requirements to implement

test_questions.question: What is a common reason for merge conflicts in GitHub?

options.A: Multiple people make changes to the same line of a file on different branches
options.B: Using different programming languages
options.C: Having too many comments in code

test_questions.question: Which statement correctly describes a Project Board and a Workflow in GitHub?

options.A: Project Board is a list of tasks or features in a repository, while a Workflow is a set of automated steps triggered by specific events like pushes or pulls
options.B: Project Board is for storing code, while Workflow is for documentation
options.C: Both are the same thing in GitHub
options.D: Project Board is for backups, Workflow is for deployment only

test_questions.question: Match the agile frameworks with their key characteristics:

options.A: Scrum → Time-boxed iterations (sprints) with defined roles and meetings
options.B: Extreme Programming (XP) → Heavy focus on pair programming, test-driven development, and user stories
options.C: Kanban → Visualizes workflow using a board and limits work in progress
options.D: Waterfall → Sequential phases with no going back

test_questions.question: What are the benefits of using GitHub Actions? (Select all that apply)

options.A: Automating workflows such as testing and deployments
options.B: Creating and publishing reusable workflows for other repositories
options.C: Integrating Continuous Integration (CI) into repositories
options.D: Replacing the need for version control

test_questions.question: Match the framework activity with its description:

options.A: Communication → Understanding stakeholders' requirements
options.B: Planning → Creating a project schedule and allocating resources
options.C: Deployment → Delivering the software to the customer
options.D: Construction → Coding and testing the solution
options.E: Maintenance → Fixing bugs and adding new features after deployment

test_questions.question: What is the main purpose of Continuous Integration (CI) in GitHub Actions?

options.A: To ensure that code changes are tested automatically before being merged
options.B: To store code in the cloud
options.C: To create documentation automatically

test_questions.question: What is the primary purpose of early testing in the spiral model?

options.A: To assess risks and refine prototypes
options.B: To finalize requirements before development begins
options.C: To ensure all documentation is completed
options.D: To eliminate the need for risk management

test_questions.question: What are the primary disadvantages of the waterfall model? (Select all that apply)

options.A: Testing occurs late in the process
options.B: It depends on the early availability of detailed requirements
options.C: It does not accommodate changing requirements effectively
options.E: It lacks customer involvement during initial stages

test_questions.question: Match the stages of the DevOps process with their descriptions:

options.A: Continuous Integration → Merging new code with the existing codebase and verifying compatibility
options.B: Continuous Testing → Using automated tools to validate code functionality and identify defects
options.C: Continuous Deployment → Delivering tested software to production environments
options.D: Refactoring code → Improving code structure without changing behavior

test_questions.question: Match the GitHub tools or concepts with their benefits:

options.A: Markdown → Lightweight text formatting for documentation and README files
options.B: GitHub Pages → Hosting static websites directly from a repository
options.C: GitHub Copilot → AI-powered code suggestions to speed up development
options.D: Reusable Workflows → Simplify workflow management by sharing workflows across repositories

test_questions.question: Match the agile practices with their definitions:

options.A: Pair Programming → Two developers work together at one computer to write and review code in real-time
options.B: Refactoring → Improving the internal structure of code without changing its external behavior
options.C: Continuous Integration → Frequently integrating new code to detect and resolve compatibility issues early
options.D: Test-Driven Development → Writing unit tests before coding begins
options.E: Big Bang Delivery → Delivering all features at once

test_questions.question: Complete the sentence about software engineering framework activities: The software engineering process includes five key framework activities: ______ is the initial stage where requirements are gathered, ______ helps guide the project with plans and schedules, and ______ focuses on creating models to better understand requirements and design.

options.A: Requirements gathering → Communication
options.B: Project guidance with plans and schedules  → Planning
options.C: Creating models to understand requirements and design  → Modeling
